definition: to a complete degree or to the full or entire extent (`whole' is often used informally for `wholly'), including all components without exception, an assemblage of parts that is regarded as a single entity
details:
adverb
- to a complete degree or to the full or entire extent (`whole' is often used informally for `wholly')
= synonyms: wholly
adjective
- including all components without exception
- (of siblings) having the same parents
= example: (of siblings) having the same parents
- acting together as a single undiversified whole
= synonyms: solid
- exhibiting or restored to vigorous good health
= synonyms: hale
- not injured
= synonyms: unharmed
noun
- an assemblage of parts that is regarded as a single entity
= example: an assemblage of parts that is regarded as a single entity
= synonyms: unit
- all of something including all its component elements or parts
= example: all of something including all its component elements or parts
